comments:
Doing testcase JVEEVNT02
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/vep-home/WebContent/docs/testcases/events2/events2.htm

Created a brand new java project, imported the zip mentioned in the testcase and
opened file com.ibm.ivj.examples.vc.customerinfo.CustomerInfoS2.java with VE.
The following NPEs followed ending with a NPE dialog being shown to the user.

One of things I did was to select the JDT outline view and hit the 'Sort' action
during the load.

Created an attachment (id=20019)
Log of exceptions

Log of exceptions

The problem is recreatable and the Java Beans view is completely messed up with
a ? at the root.

Rich, there seems to be many variation for this "lack of introspection" problem.
 I have seen similar problems before, but could never recreate them.
*** Bug 88079 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem is Style2 event parsing. It is not creating the "event" property on
the event invocation for window closing.

It looks like:

<events xsi:type="org.eclipse.ve.internal.jcm:EventInvocation"
listener="/0/@listenerTypes.0/@listeners.0">
  <callbacks>
    <method
href="java:/java.awt.event#WindowListener.windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent"/>
  </callbacks>
</events>

It is supposed to look like:

<events xsi:type="org.eclipse.ve.internal.jcm:EventInvocation"
listener="/0/@listenerTypes.0/@listeners.0">
  <callbacks>
    <method
href="java:/java.awt.event#WindowListener.windowClosing(java.awt.event.WindowEvent"/>
  </callbacks>
  <event href="java:/java.awt#Window/event/window"/>
</events>

Was able to open style 2 file fine.
Verified in VE 1.1-M1 RC1 build
